fields.headline: Travel tips
fields.bodyText: When visiting Los Angeles, take 'Big Blue' bus No 3 if you want to get to either Venice or Santa Monica beach. Just hop on the free shuttle bus at 'C' stand from LAX airport to 'C' parking lot. Then pay $0.75 (25 cents for elders over 62) and ask for a free transfer if needed. The journeys take 30 and 41 minutes, respectively. A Kearn The view from the top of Spain's highest mountain, Pico del Teide, in Tenerife is well worth the effort of climbing the last 163m beyond the cable car. However, only 150 people a day are allowed access to the top and they have to have a permit. This is available in advance from the National Park office in Santa Cruz, at 5 Calle Emilio Calzadilla. To apply, simply take your passport to the office between 9am and 2pm. You will then be asked to choose a specific time slot when you wish to visit the summit. Allan Morrison Assess the relative safety of a particular area by observing the way in which women carry their handbags. For example, held free - no problems; slung across the body - be alert to possible difficulties. Sue Hunter · If you have any tips to share with your fellow readers, write to Travel tips, The Guardian, 119 Farringdon Road, London EC1R 3ER, or email travel.tips@theguardian.com.
